result.execSummary:
The defendant Brice Scott Moltzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
Must complete a Mental Health Assessment and compliance.

Cannot vote. Cannot hold public office. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation. Not to possess, purchase or sell alcohol. Not to possess, purchase or sell mood altering substances, drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Subject to testing. Must complete ATR (bootcamp) program. Must participate in recommend treatments and comply with all recommendations.

superTimeConds.notes: To be completed each year while on probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brice Scott Moltzer
